summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing victim notification and management for the Epstein case, specifically coordinating between New York and Miami investigations. The emails focus on using the Victim Notification System (VNS) to track victims and ensure they receive their legal rights.

events.title: FBI coordination on Epstein victim lists
events.description: FBI personnel in New York and Miami coordinate via email to manage and cross-check victim lists for the Epstein case using the Victim Notification System (VNS).

keyFacts: The FBI uses a Victim Notification System (VNS) tied to multiple agencies (FBI, USAO, BOP, USPIS, Marshals) to notify victims of federal crimes and track cases.
There is coordination between the New York and Miami FBI offices regarding victim lists for the Epstein case, indicating multi-district investigation efforts.
The email discusses having a 'Total Victim' list and a process to identify which victims still need to be added to VNS with missing data.
The communication is marked with a confidentiality notice warning against unauthorized disclosure of Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
